string-array.name: QuotesList
string-array.item: "Our smartphones have become a digital extension of ourselves."
"A smartphone can be both a blessing and a curse."
"With a smartphone in hand, the world is at your fingertips."
"The more we use our smartphones, the more they seem to use us."
"A smartphone is a powerful tool, use it wisely."
"In a world of constant connection, our smartphones keep us tethered."
"The convenience of a smartphone can sometimes make us forget the value of face-to-face interactions."
"Smartphones have changed the way we communicate, for better or for worse."
"Our smartphones may be smart, but it's up to us to be even smarter with how we use them."
"With great power (of a smartphone) comes great responsibility."
The average person checks their smartphone over 100 times a day.
The world first smartphone, the IBM Simon, was introduced in 1993 and cost $899.
The average lifespan of a smartphone is about 2-3 years.
Over 85% of smartphone users check their devices while speaking with friends and family.
The word "selfie" was added to the Oxford English Dictionary in 2013, thanks to the rise of smartphone cameras.
The iPhone is the best-selling smartphone brand of all time, with over 2.2 billion units sold.
In Japan, it is considered rude to talk on your smartphone on public transportation.
The average person spends over 4 hours a day on their smartphone.
More people now access the internet on their smartphones than on desktop computers.
The world most expensive smartphone, the Falcon Supernova iPhone 6 Pink Diamond, sold for $48.5 million in 2019.

Practice good posture and avoid hunching over your smartphone for extended periods of time.
